messages.subject: Are there good, current Christian unschooling resources?
messages.msgSnippet: From my http://sandradodd.com/world page Turns out only the third of these links works, and it s linking to pages that are gone, too. If anyone knows current
messages.messageBody:
From my http://sandradodd.com/world page



Turns out only the third of these links works, and it's linking to
pages that are gone, too.

If anyone knows current links for the 1, 2 and 4 of the list below,
I'd love to update those.



If there are other resources for unschoolers with a Christian focus,
please let me know.

(Although I feel kind of the same way about that as I do any other add-
ons; unschooling works the same way for Christians, "law of
attraction"oids, republicans, vegetarians, Buddhists...)

--------------------

Christian:

Radical Christian Unschoolers
"a place for Christians to talk about real, radical unschooling...no
curriculum talk, no coercive parenting, no chore charts or forced
respect of children. It is for people who already "get" radical
unschooling, and are living it in their homes."
The Inspirit site has information on the book Christian Unschooling -
Growing Your Children in the Freedom of Christ,and there is a review
on a different site, with other useful links (links page on Christian
Unschooling) for Christians.

Here is a great list of links to Christian unschooling resources from
Home Sweet Homeschool.

Amy Bell's Natural Learning Page with an LDS focus
